scenario: Foreign-made phone shipments in China dropped 47.4% to 3.04 million units in November, with Apple accounting for the majority of these shipments. Apple's iPhone sales in China fell 0.3% year-on-year in the third quarter, leaving it with a 15.6% market share. Huawei saw a 42% increase in market share, reaching 15.3%, while Vivo claimed the top spot in September with a 19% share. China's government has announced the expansion of consumption subsidies to include smartphones and other electronics, expected to benefit domestic brands like Huawei and Xiaomi. Apple has responded with a promotional event in China, offering discounts on several iPhone 16 models.
